intro: Meyerophytum, commonly known as the meadow gentian, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Gentianaceae. It is characterized by its showy, blue or purple flowers that typically bloom in late summer. The plants are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including parts of Europe, Asia, and North America. Meyerophytum species are often found in meadows, grasslands, and along stream banks. They are generally herbaceous perennials that thrive in moist, well-drained soils.
